item.title: Dangerous/large pothole/road defect, 13th August
item.description:
This issue has remained unresolved for some time. A patch of tarmac was poorly laid over a manhole cover, which was clearly not a suitable fix. The surface is now deteriorating further, creating a hazardous and uneven section of road that’s particularly dangerous for cyclists.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Ledbury Road, Maida Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roads damaged by heavy electric busses cause shaking to houses and noise pollution, 13th August
item.description:
Likely to be ignored and closed without investigation but the problem is very serious and is not being looked at or taken seriously, Road is not coping well with the speeding double decker buses, When the bus’s travel over the surface they create a lot of noise and vibration which shakes my entire house. This wakes me up at all hours of the night and early morning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Antisocial gathering drinking and drugs, 13th August
item.description:
The corner of HSBC has become a hang out for street drinking, drug use, and excessive littering. It is uncomfortable to walk past everyday as a resident of Wilberforce rd.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Seven Sisters Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti and Litter including Hazardous Material, 13th August
item.description:
The footpath between Millwood Road and Brantwood Way needs clearing of hazardous material - large gas canisters, and other litter and the hedges (now including brambles) need cutting and the cuttings removed. Graffiti has been painted on a section of fence too, and needs removal. We’ve not suffered from the latter before and it would be good to nip it in the bud.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Brantwood Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
